p: Early studies have shown the capacity of flaxseed supplementation in the diet to alter the bacterial flora in the intestines of animals. For example, flaxseed supplemented to the diet of mice will alter Enterobacteriaceae diversity and prevalence in the feces and cecum [ 77]. Power and colleagues [ 78] showed that a flaxseed supplemented diet will alter the microbial microenvironment in the colon with a 20-fold increase in Prevotella spp. and a 30-fold decrease in Akkermansia muciniphila abundance. Others have shown that a combined high fat, flaxseed and fish oil supplemented diet increased the abundance of intestinal Bifidobacterium [ 79].
